intro: Jacobaea ambigua subsp. ambigua, commonly known as the narrowleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. The species is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
